alert.note: Alert for Surry; Wilkes; Yadkin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 4:41PM EDT until July 06 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Surry. In northwest North Carolina, Wilkes and Yadkin. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain producing showers and storms that prompted the advisory have exited the area. However, minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area as the earlier rain water collects in low lying areas, creeks, and streams. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Elkin Creek, Arnold Branch, Camp Creek, Dobbins Creek, East Swan Creek, Cobb Creek, Dugger Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Big Bugaboo Creek and Cranberry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkin... Yadkinville... Jonesville... Boonville... Ronda... Swancreek... Arlington... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
